alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Dougherty; Lee; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 10:53AM EDT until June 15 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Northern Calhoun County in southwestern Georgia... Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Dougherty County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Lee County in southwestern Georgia... Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Southern Terrell County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 1245 PM CDT /145 PM EDT/. * At 953 AM CDT /1053 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Gaines, Morgan, Cuthbert, Dawson, Leesburg, Albany, Edison, Shellman, Walker, Sasser, Bellville, Bluffton, Aycock Mill, Martins Crossroads, Fountain Bridge, Cordrays Mill, Goffs Mill, Doverel, Dickey and Pachitla. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Clay; Dougherty; Lee; Randolph; Terrell
